importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication indicates a recent NFL game that highlights the continued competitiveness of aging athletes, reinforcing public interest in the longevity and performance of veteran sports figures.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame reflects the live broadcast of a high-stakes NFL game, emphasizing real-time sports engagement and the public's fascination with live athletic competition.

keyTakeAways: Joe Flacco, 40 years old, outperformed Aaron Rodgers, 41 years old, in a high-scoring game, leading the Cincinnati Bengals to a 33-31 victory over the Pittsburgh Steelers.
The game, dubbed the 'Icy Hot Bowl' by Steelers teammate Cameron Heyward, showcased that aging quarterbacks can still perform at elite levels in professional football.
Flacco threw for 342 yards and three touchdowns, including key drives in the final minutes to secure the win, marking his first victory with the Bengals after a difficult debut.

The Bengals' offense, led by Ja’Marr Chase (16 catches, 161 yards) and Tee Higgins (6 catches, 96 yards, season-high), was dominant, with Chase Brown rushing for over 100 yards for the first time this season.
Aaron Rodgers, despite a loss, threw for four touchdowns and two interceptions, and moved to fifth place in NFL all-time career passing yards, surpassing Ben Roethlisberger.
The game featured a pivotal 20-point rally by the Bengals, which turned a 10-0 deficit into a win after a dramatic final drive.
Rodgers' milestone passing yards highlight a broader narrative about the enduring legacy and performance of veteran NFL players.
The result kept the Bengals' record at 3-4, while the Steelers dropped to 4-2 but still lead the AFC North, setting up a key matchup against the Green Bay Packers in Week 8.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In a dramatic and historic matchup dubbed the 'Icy Hot Bowl,' 40-year-old Joe Flacco outperformed 41-year-old Aaron Rodgers in a high-scoring game between the Cincinnati Bengals and Pittsburgh Steelers. Flacco, acquired to replace injured Joe Burrow and after a disappointing debut, delivered a masterful performance with 342 yards and three touchdowns, including a crucial two-minute drive that secured a 33-31 win. The Bengals rallied from a 10-0 deficit, with 20 consecutive points, and Chase Brown rushed for over 100 yards for the first time. Rodgers, despite the loss, threw four touchdowns and two interceptions and moved into fifth place on the NFL all-time passing yards list, surpassing Ben Roethlisberger. The game highlighted the enduring competitiveness of veteran quarterbacks and the resilience of both teams in a pivotal NFL matchup, with the Bengals now 3-4 and the Steelers 4-2 and still leading the AFC North.
title: Joe Flacco outduels Aaron Rodgers in battle of elder statesmen as Bengals stun Steelers in 'Icy Hot Bowl'
